meanings.definition: The state or quality of being opaque.
meanings.sent1: The opacities of the window prevented us from seeing outside clearly.
meanings.sent2: The opacities of the water made it difficult to see the fish swimming below.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved creating opacities in the air to hide the disappearing coin.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like opacities, shielding her true feelings from everyone.
meanings.sent5: The opacities in the room added an air of mystery to the atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Something that is opaque, especially a cloudiness in the lens of the eye.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that cataracts are opacities that can affect vision.
meanings.sent2: The photographer adjusted the lens to reduce the opacities in the image.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child claimed to have opacities in his eyes to avoid doing homework.
meanings.sent4: Her lies acted as opacities, clouding the truth from those around her.
meanings.sent5: The opacities in his eyes made it seem like he was always deep in thought.
